class Pin - control I/O pins¶

Usage:

from robot_hat import Pin

pin = Pin("D0")                      # create an Pin object from a pin
val = pin.value()                    # read an analog value

pin.value(0)                         # set gpio to low level

Constructors¶

class robot_hat.Pin(value) A pin is the basic object to control I/O pins. It has methods to set the mode of the pin (input, output, etc) and methods to get and set the digital logic level.

Methods¶

  • value - Read the value on the analog pin and return it. The returned value will be between 0 and 4095.

Pin.value() #Without parameters, read gpio level, high level returns 1, low level returns

Pin.value(0)  # set to low level
Pin.value(1)  # set to high level

  • switch

Pin.on() # set to high level
#off() - set to high level
#high() - set to high level
#low() - set to high level

  • mode - setup gpio mode

Pin.mode(GPIO.IN)  # set gipo to INPUT mode

Availble pins¶

  • "D0"

  • "D1"

  • "D2"

  • "D3"

  • "D4"

  • "D5"

  • "D6"

  • "D7"

  • "D8"

  • "D9"

  • "SW"

  • "LED"
